intro: Miconia macayana, commonly known as the white miconia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves that are usually bright green and glossy. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces berries that are initially green and turn red when mature. Miconia macayana is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
